page.title: 03Local History Witgar's Story
page.content: When the Normans invaded England in 1066 the owner of Bures Mill was a man called Witgar. When he heard of the invasion Witgar realised that the Normans would want to take over his mill. He was unwilling to give in without a fight and so he took the querns, which were the stones used to crush the corn, and threw them into the flood gate so that the mill could not be used. There is no record of what happened to Witgar but ever since his day there has been a mill on the same site.
